text: What is the term for a matrix with the same number of rows and columns?
What is the determinant of a 2x2 matrix [a b; c d]?
What is the name of a matrix that has all its elements equal to zero?
What is the rank of a matrix?
answer: The maximum number of linearly independent rows or columns
a: The maximum number of linearly independent rows or columns

text: What is the transpose of a matrix?
answer: A new matrix obtained by interchanging rows and columns
a: A new matrix obtained by interchanging rows and columns
b: A new matrix obtained by multiplying each element by -1
c: A new matrix obtained by adding a scalar to each element
d: A new matrix obtained by multiplying each element by a scalar

text: What is an eigenvalue of a matrix?
answer: A scalar that satisfies the equation Ax = λx
a: A scalar that satisfies the equation Ax = λx
b: A vector that satisfies the equation Ax = λx
c: A matrix that satisfies the equation Ax = λx
d: A scalar that satisfies the equation A + λ = 0

answer: A square matrix with ones on the diagonal and zeros elsewhere
a: A square matrix with ones on the diagonal and zeros elsewhere
b: A square matrix with zeros on the diagonal and ones elsewhere
c: A matrix with all elements equal to one
d: A matrix with all elements equal to zero

text: What is the trace of a square matrix?
answer: The sum of the diagonal elements
a: The sum of the diagonal elements
b: The product of the diagonal elements

answer: A set of vectors that can be added together and multiplied by scalars
a: A set of vectors that can be added together and multiplied by scalars
b: A set of vectors that can only be added together
c: A set of vectors that can only be multiplied by scalars
d: A set of vectors that are linearly dependent

text: What is the inverse of a matrix?
answer: A matrix that, when multiplied with the original matrix, results in the identity matrix
a: A matrix that, when multiplied with the original matrix, results in the identity matrix
b: A matrix that, when added to the original matrix, results in the zero matrix
c: A matrix that, when subtracted from the original matrix, results in the identity matrix
d: A matrix that, when divided by the original matrix, results in the identity matrix
